intro: Fumaria vaillantii var. caespitosa, commonly known as the clustered yellow rocket, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems that often form dense clusters, giving it a tufted appearance. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers with four petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and slightly hairy, with a distinctive waxy coating. Native to regions of Europe and western Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
